meanings.definition: The act of entrusting a task or responsibility to another person or group.
meanings.sent1: The teacher's delegation of grading papers to the student helper saved her time.
meanings.sent2: The delegation of planning the event was given to the experienced team.
meanings.sent3: The delegation of dishwashing duty to the cat was a funny mix-up.
meanings.sent4: Her delegation of organizing the books was like passing a baton in a relay race.
meanings.sent5: The delegation of feeding the fish made the child feel important and grown-up.

meanings.definition: A group of people chosen to represent others or make decisions on their behalf.
meanings.sent1: The delegation from the company attended the conference to negotiate deals.
meanings.sent2: The student council delegation met with the principal to discuss school issues.
meanings.sent3: The delegation of teddy bears at the tea party was quite a sight.
meanings.sent4: The delegation of birds on the wire looked like a united front against the storm.
meanings.sent5: The delegation of toys in the playroom seemed to have a secret meeting.
